intro: Jamesbrittenia sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are typically sessile, meaning they lack stalks. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
